pageProps.contentHtml:
Egorov's theorem, Lp spaces

Let fn ⁣:R3→R\func{f_n}{\R^3}{\R}fn​:R3→R be a sequence of functions such that sup⁡n∥fn∥L2<∞\sup_n\norm{f_n}_{L^2} < \inftysupn​∥fn​∥L2​<∞. Show that if fnf_nfn​ converges almost everywhere to a function f ⁣:R3→R\func{f}{\R^3}{\R}f:R3→R, then

∫R3∣∣fn∣2−∣fn−f∣2−∣f∣2∣ dx→0.\int_{\R^3} \abs{\abs{f_n}^2 - \abs{f_n - f}^2 - \abs{f}^2} \,\diff{x} \to 0.∫R3​∣∣​∣fn​∣2−∣fn​−f∣2−∣f∣2∣∣​dx→0.
Solution.

First, observe that

∣∣fn∣2−∣fn−f∣2−∣f∣2∣=∣∣fn∣2−(fn2+f2−2ffn)−∣f∣2∣=∣2ffn−2f2∣=2∣f∣∣f−fn∣.\begin{aligned} \abs{\abs{f_n}^2 - \abs{f_n - f}^2 - \abs{f}^2} &= \abs{\abs{f_n}^2 - \p{f_n^2 + f^2 - 2ff_n} - \abs{f}^2} \\ &= \abs{2ff_n - 2f^2} \\ &= 2\abs{f}\abs{f - f_n}. \end{aligned}∣∣​∣fn​∣2−∣fn​−f∣2−∣f∣2∣∣​​=∣∣​∣fn​∣2−(fn2​+f2−2ffn​)−∣f∣2∣∣​=∣∣​2ffn​−2f2∣∣​=2∣f∣∣f−fn​∣.​

Let M=sup⁡n∥fn∥L2M = \sup_n \norm{f_n}_{L^2}M=supn​∥fn​∥L2​, and so by Fatou's lemma,

∫∣f∣2≤lim inf⁡n→∞∫∣fn∣2≤M2<∞\int \abs{f}^2 \leq \liminf_{n\to\infty} \int \abs{f_n}^2 \leq M^2 < \infty∫∣f∣2≤n→∞liminf​∫∣fn​∣2≤M2<∞

by assumption. In other words, f∈L2(R3)f \in L^2\p{\R^3}f∈L2(R3). We need to analyze

∫R3∣∣fn∣2−∣fn−f∣2−∣f∣2∣ dx=∫R32∣f∣∣f−fn∣ dx.\int_{\R^3} \abs{\abs{f_n}^2 - \abs{f_n - f}^2 - \abs{f}^2} \,\diff{x} = \int_{\R^3} 2\abs{f}\abs{f - f_n} \,\diff{x}.∫R3​∣∣​∣fn​∣2−∣fn​−f∣2−∣f∣2∣∣​dx=∫R3​2∣f∣∣f−fn​∣dx.

Let ε>0\epsilon > 0ε>0. Since f∈L2(R3)f \in L^2\p{\R^3}f∈L2(R3), there exists R>0R > 0R>0 large enough so that

∫B(0,R)c∣f∣2<ε.\int_{B\p{0,R}^\comp} \abs{f}^2 < \epsilon.∫B(0,R)c​∣f∣2<ε.

Also, observe that E↦∫E∣f∣2 dxE \mapsto \int_E \abs{f}^2 \,\diff{x}E↦∫E​∣f∣2dx is a measure absolutely continuous with respect to the Lebesgue measure. Hence, there exists δ>0\delta > 0δ>0 such that if m(E)<δm\p{E} < \deltam(E)<δ, then ∫E∣f∣2 dx<ε\int_E \abs{f}^2 \,\diff{x} < \epsilon∫E​∣f∣2dx<ε.

On the other hand, since B(0,R)B\p{0, R}B(0,R) is a set of finite measure, Egorov's theorem gives us a set E⊆B(0,R)E \subseteq B\p{0, R}E⊆B(0,R) such that fn→ff_n \to ffn​→f uniformly on B(0,R)∖EB\p{0, R} \setminus EB(0,R)∖E and m(E)<δm\p{E} < \deltam(E)<δ, where mmm denotes the Lebesgue measure. Thus, on B(0,R)∖EB\p{0, R} \setminus EB(0,R)∖E, there exists N∈NN \in \NN∈N such that ∣fn−f∣<ε\abs{f_n - f} < \epsilon∣fn​−f∣<ε uniformly, and so by Cauchy-Schwarz,

∫R32∣f∣∣f−fn∣ dx=∫B(0,R)∖E2∣f∣∣f−fn∣ dx+∫E2∣f∣∣f−fn∣ dx+∫B(0,R)c2∣f∣∣f−fn∣ dx≤2∥f∥L2∥(f−fn)χB(0,R)∖E∥L2+2∥fχE∥L2∥f−fn∥L2+2∥fχB(0,R)c∥L2∥f−fn∥L2≤2Mε1/2+4Mε1/2+4Mε1/2=10Mε1/2.\begin{aligned} \int_{\R^3} 2\abs{f}\abs{f - f_n} \,\diff{x} &= \int_{B\p{0, R} \setminus E} 2\abs{f}\abs{f - f_n} \,\diff{x} + \int_E 2\abs{f}\abs{f - f_n} \,\diff{x} + \int_{B\p{0, R}^\comp} 2\abs{f}\abs{f - f_n} \,\diff{x} \\ &\leq 2 \norm{f}_{L^2} \norm{\p{f - f_n}\chi_{B\p{0,R} \setminus E}}_{L^2} + 2 \norm{f\chi_E}_{L^2} \norm{f - f_n}_{L^2} + 2\norm{f\chi_{B\p{0,R}^\comp}}_{L^2} \norm{f - f_n}_{L^2} \\ &\leq 2M\epsilon^{1/2} + 4M\epsilon^{1/2} + 4M\epsilon^{1/2} \\ &= 10M\epsilon^{1/2}. \end{aligned}∫R3​2∣f∣∣f−fn​∣dx​=∫B(0,R)∖E​2∣f∣∣f−fn​∣dx+∫E​2∣f∣∣f−fn​∣dx+∫B(0,R)c​2∣f∣∣f−fn​∣dx≤2∥f∥L2​∥∥​(f−fn​)χB(0,R)∖E​∥∥​L2​+2∥fχE​∥L2​∥f−fn​∥L2​+2∥∥​fχB(0,R)c​∥∥​L2​∥f−fn​∥L2​≤2Mε1/2+4Mε1/2+4Mε1/2=10Mε1/2.​

Sending ε→0\epsilon \to 0ε→0, we get the claim.
